item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Don't try to solve serious matters in the middle of the night." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Eddie Izzard
item.description: "I am an evil Giraffe." -- Eddie Izzard

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Eighty percent of success is showing up." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Bisexuality immediately doubles your chances for a date on Saturday night." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "It's a match made in heaven...by a retarded angel." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Love blurs your vision; but after it recedes, you can see more clearly than ever. It's like the tide going out, revealing whatever's been thrown away and sunk: broken bottles, old gloves, rusting pop cans, nibbled fishbodies, bones. This is the kind of thing you see if you sit in the darkness with open eyes, not knowing the future. The ruin you've made." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "But I began then to think of time as having a shape, something you could see, like a series of liquid transparencies, one laid on top of another." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Old lovers go the way of old photographs, bleaching out gradually as in a slow bath of acid: first the moles and pimples, then the shadings. Then the faces themselves, until nothing remains but the general outlines." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "He considers me also a little fragile because artistic. I need to be cared for, like a potted plant." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jillian Lee add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "There's blood, a taste I remember. It tastes of orange popsicles, penny gumballs, red licorice, gnawed hair, dirty ice." -- Margaret Atwood
